t: What is AWS Lambda? - AWS Lambda
s: Lambda is a compute service that you can use to build applications without provisioning or managing servers.

t: Serverless Function, FaaS Serverless - AWS Lambda - AWS
s: AWS Lambda is a serverless compute service for running code without having to provision or manage servers. You pay only for the compute time you consume.

2 days ago - AWS Lambda is a serverless compute service that runs your code in response to events and automatically manages the underlying compute resources for you. These events may include changes in state or an update, such as a user placing an item in a shopping cart on an ecommerce website.

April 8, 2025 - AWS Lambda is an event-driven, serverless Function as a Service (FaaS) provided by Amazon as a part of Amazon Web Services. t: AWS Lambda introduces tiered pricing for Amazon CloudWatch logs and additional logging destinations | Amazon Web Services
s: 3 weeks ago - Effective logging is an important part of an observability strategy when building serverless applications using AWS Lambda. t: Serverless Computing – AWS Lambda Pricing – Amazon Web Services
s: With AWS Lambda, you pay only for what you use. You are charged based on the number of requests for your functions and the time your code executes.

t: What is AWS Lambda? | Definition from TechTarget
s: Learn about AWS Lambda, an event-driven cloud computing service where developers run code without having to manage underlying resources, and its uses.

t: AWS Lambda standardizes billing for INIT Phase | Amazon Web Services
s: 3 weeks ago - Effective August 1, 2025, AWS will standardize billing for the initialization (INIT) phase across all AWS Lambda function configurations.
